titles.title: Providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 861) declaring that the United States will prevail in the Global War on Terror, the struggle to protect freedom from the terrorist adversary.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-502, by Mr. Cole (OK).

During consideration of H. Res. 861, pursuant to H. Res. 868, and notwithstanding the operation of the previous question, the Chair may postpone further consideration of the resolution to a time designated by the Speaker.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 195.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 868.
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on H. Res. 868.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 222 - 194 (Roll no. 287).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/15/2006--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.Res. 861 (debate on the war in Iraq and the war on terrorism).
